mdRecord.dcterms:title: The last [rose] of summer
Last rose of summer
Tis the last rose of summer
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Magnus, Charles.
Moore, Thomas, 1779-1852
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Published by Chas. Magnus, 12 Frankfort St. NY
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Song sheet in three stanzas; without music. Printed in black on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue.
First lines: Tis the last rose of summer, left blooming alone.
With advertisement "Ten illustrated Songs on Notepaper, mailed to any Address on receipt of 50 Cents."
Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York, between 1860 and 1867.
Hand-colored illustration of a rose appears in place of the word in the title; the whole is printed within a double rule border with ornamented corners. Magnus 256a. Cf. American song sheets, 1227e?
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Twenty-third of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Roses--Songs and music--Texts
Roses--Pictorial works
